column1: Note: data is manually entered, so the values are not standardized.

column2: Description
Student ID is made up of three attributes: <Course code>-<Intake No>/<Index Number of student in the intake>
Gender
Singapore Citizen
Singapore Permanent Citizen
Neither SG Citizen nor SG PR
column3: Y or empty (this and the above 2 fields are mutually exclusive)

column2: Country name of the nationality of either SG PR or foreigner
column3: Malaysia, India, China, etc.  Blank for SG Citizen.

column2: Date of Birth. Format is DD/MM/YYYY (all date fields use this format)
Highest qualification attained prior to taking this course
Institutes where the highest qualification was attained
Date when the highest qualification was awarded
Job designation
Date when the course starts
Date when the course ends
column3: 6/4/2024.  Blank if the course is still going on.

column2: Whether the course is Part-time or Full-time

Whether the course is sponsored or self-funded.  
SFC - SkillsFuture Credit
SDF - Skills Development Funds
column3: Individual, Individual - SFC, Sponsored, Individual - waived App Fee

column2: Description
Course code in 4 digits
Course name
Description
The same Student ID that should be found in the Student Profile dataset.
Semester Number
column3:
Below is the number of semesters in each course:
- Certificate - 1 semester
- Diploma - 3 semesters
- Specialist Diploma - 2 semesters
There are exceptions where a student takes more semesters to complete a course.

column2: GPA of the semester
column3:
Maximum GPA is 4. 
Passing GPA for Certificates and Diploma: 2
Passing GPA for Specialist Diploma: 2.3

column1: At the end of the semester, every student is to fill up a survey that contains the following fields.

column2: Description
The same Student ID that should be found in the Student Profile dataset.
Semester Number
column3: Same as in the dataset “Student Results”

column2: Student will rate how much he/she knows about the subjects before the semester starts.
column3: Rating from the least (1) to the most (5)

column2: How much the student thinks the course is relevant to his/her job or future study
column3: Rating from the least (1) to the most (5)

column2: How much support the student has gained from the teachers or the material provided
column3: Rating from the least (1) to the most (5)

column2: How much support the student has gained from the company, e.g. sponsorship, time-off, less workload
column3: Rating from the least (1) to the most (5)

column2: How much support from the family, e.g. adequate time for self-study over weekend, no family finance issue
column3: Rating from the least (1) to the most (5)

column2: The number of hours spent per week on self-study before or after lesson, e.g. to read material before lesson, to revise material, to do assignments or projects.
